<<<<<<< HEAD
The poore's pension: a sermon preached in Gregories Church in Sudbury in the county of Suffolke, May 12. 1643. Upon occasion of the charitable reliefe that yearly then, and there is given, towards the covering or clothing of a hundred poore people, according to the will of the donour M Martine Cole, late of the towne aforesaid deceased. By Samuel Rogers, Master in Arts, and Minister of Much-Tey in Essex. Imprimatur Ja. Cranford, Aug. 12. 1644. Rogers, Samuel.
[6], 38 p.
Printed by G. M. for Edward Brewster at the signe of the Bible on Fleet-bridge, London : 1644.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Sept: 23.". Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

Upon occasion of the charitable reliefe that yearly then, and there is given, towards the covering or clothing of a hundred poore people, according to the will of the donour M Martine Cole, late of the towne aforesaid deceased. By Samuel Rogers, Master in Arts, and Minister of Much-Tey in Essex. Imprimatur Ja. Cranford, Aug. 12. 1644. Rogers, Samuel.
[6], 38 p.
Printed by G. M. for Edward Brewster at the signe of the Bible on Fleet-bridge, London : 1644.
